plugins.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

135957.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
135957.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., “US zip code”, “company name”, “city in Japan”).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs to communicate with OpenAI's API to generate AI-powered text content for selected layers in Figma.

135957.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

plugins.name: JSON Frame Mapper
plugins.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens


---


## The data


Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"name": [Item 1's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

{

"name": [Item 2's name/title],

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---


## Other stuff


- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- On successfully loading a JSON, it will display the number of items and fields such as ```25 items with 23 fields loaded```

- It looks for {{fieldNames}} whenever a frame is selected so you can deselect or select another frame/template after the JSON is loaded

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field
plugins.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

137181.name: JSON Frame Mapper
137181.description:
# JSON Frame Mapper: Figma Plugin


## Main use case


You have a number of items with data in a collection as a single source of truth.


You also have a Figma design which you would like to use as a template.


You would like to create as many items as you have in your collection, with the data from each item using your Figma design as a template.


Wouldn't it be useful to map the data to the template, press a button and - BAM! - loads of content based on the template with the data from your collection?


I think so.


---


This plugin is completely free so feel free to not buy me a [coffee](https://buymeacoffee.com/shragor)


Although... if you did, you could leave a message asking for functional upgrades which I would consider 🤔


---


## How the thing works


1. Install the plugin in Figma (you should know how to do this)

2. Pick the frame you want to use as a template

3. Alter the fieldNames you want populated with your JSON data - note, change the name of the field, not the value - by surrounding them like {{this}}

4. Open the plugin (you can do this at any time tbh)

5. Click "Load JSON File" to load your JSON file (check next section for the required format)

6. If your frame is not selected, select it by clicking its name

7. JSON Frame Mapper will attempt to map {{fieldNames}} to Fields

8. You can manually change the mapping of fieldNames to JSON fields if you want to

9. Set "Generation Settings". Frames are generated from left to right starting from the right of the template (so make sure you have room!)

10. Frame separation sets the number of pixels between generated frames

11. Max horizontal frames sets the maximum number of frames generated to the right before it moves to a new line below the first generated frames

12. The "Generate Frames" button is there but I don't remember why. Give it a shot and see if anything happens

Currently the **JSON Frame Mapper** accepts only a JSON in this form:


```

[

{

"field1": [VALUE],

"field2": [VALUE],

...

{

"field2": [VALUE],

...

},

...

]

```


So, an array of objects with key/value pairs or fields of whatever you want to call them.


In my use case, the keys correspond to column headings in a spreadsheet I output to JSON. Each row beneath the column headings is a single item I want to use with the template.


---

- The plugin will look for a JSON field of "name", "Name", "title" or "Title" and use it as the name for the generated frame

- You can't load another or different JSON once you have loaded the first one. Unfortunately, the only way you can change JSON once loaded is:

1. Closing the Plugin

2. Exiting Figma

3. Uninstalling Figma

4. Uninstalling Windows or if Mac, upgrade your Mac to the latest silicon

5. Reinstalling Windows or opening your new Mac

6. Installing Figma

7. Installing JSON Frame Mapper Plugin

8. Opening the Plugin

- Note: only steps 1 and 8 are required for most people to clear the JSON file


## Similar plugins I tried and didn't like


- JSON -> content

- Google Sheets Sync

- Google Sheets → Figma

- Data Lab

- Google Sheets Sync

- Data Populator

- others I can't remember


## Language clarification


You *probably* don't need to read this.


*Frame* = A Figma frame, you should know what this is. It will contain your Template


*Template* = A frame where you have all the design done and text fields in place but need lots of versions of each with different text (which is in your JSON file)


*fieldNames* = The name for a field/text field etc. in your Figma Frame/Template. Some of these will contain the text you want lots of different versions of


*Item* = An individual thing in your JSON file which contains many Fields each with the data you want to map to your fieldNames and add to your Template


*Fields* = These are the names/titles/keys of the data in your JSON. Each Item will have one or more of these and each Field can be mapped to none, one or many fieldNames in the Template


*Value* = The actual value for a given Field of a given Item in your JSON. Hopefully, this will eventually appear in a Template if everything goes well


*Map* = Linking of a fieldName to a Field

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin allows users to load images and data from their local development servers. Users often run local servers on common ports (3000, 4000, 5000, 8000, 8080, 9000) to serve images, SVG files, and JSON data that they want to import into their Figma designs. Localhost access enables seamless integration with local development workflows and self-hosted content.

137181.release_notes:
Now accepts and imports SVGs.

If an object {{field}} (a rectangle or square, say) is mapped to a SVG, the object will be replaced by a frame containing a group of the SVG. The SVG will be exactly the same size, shape and location (in the design) as the parent {{field}}
137181.tagline: Create new instances of a frame/template from JSON data

plugins.name: Panto: Rename Variables in a Snap!
plugins.description: Tired of manually renaming variable prefixes one by one? Panto is here to streamline your workflow! This powerful yet simple plugin allows you to batch rename the initial segment of your Figma variable names.

plugins.name: datify
plugins.description:
Quickly update or increment dates across selected frames or text layers. It's perfect for tables, planners, and any layout where dates need to be updated regularly.


  1. Set a start date and automatically increment dates within each frame or across multiple frames
  2. Auto-detect the existing date values across selected frames
  3. Retain the original date format or choose from a list of supported formats
  4. Skip hidden layers
  5. Choose whether to increment dates continuously across all selected frames or restart within each frame
  6. Set the increment to 0 to update all date values to the same date
  7. Enter a minus sign (–) before the number to decrement the dates instead.


📅 Supported date formats:

  1. MMM D (Jan 31)
  2. D MMM YYYY (31 Jan 2025)
  3. D MMMM YYYY (31 January 2025)
  4. MMMM D, YYYY (January 31, 2025)
  5. YYYY-MM-DD (2025-01-31)
  6. DD/MM/YYYY (31/01/2025)
  7. DD-MM-YYYY (31-01-2025)
  8. D/M/YYYY (5/6/2025)
  9. M/D/YY (1/31/25)
  10. YYYY/MM/DD (2025/01/31)
  11. MMMM YYYY (January 2025)
  12. D MMM YY (31 Jan 25)
  13. D.M.YYYY (31.01.2025)
  14. YYYY. M. D (2025. 1. 31)
plugins.tagline: A quick way to update and format dates in your designs

plugins.name: Section Distributor
plugins.description:
Section Distributor is a Figma plugin that instantly organizes your Section elements into a clean, vertical stack. Simply select your sections, enter a custom spacing value, and click “Distribute” to move the first section to 0×0 and cascade all others below it at precisely that interval.


Eliminate manual nudging and pixel-perfect alignment headaches—keep your wireframes, design systems, documentation pages, and style guides consistently laid out in seconds.
plugins.tagline: Auto-stack your sections starting at 0,0 with perfect, customizable spacing—one click and done.

134431.name: Section Distributor
134431.description:
Section Distributor is a Figma plugin that instantly organizes your Section elements into a clean, vertical stack. Simply select your sections, enter a custom spacing value, and click “Distribute” to move the first section to 0×0 and cascade all others below it at precisely that interval.


Eliminate manual nudging and pixel-perfect alignment headaches—keep your wireframes, design systems, documentation pages, and style guides consistently laid out in seconds.
134431.tagline: Auto-stack your sections starting at 0,0 with perfect, customizable spacing—one click and done.

plugins.name: Wireframe Pilot
plugins.description:
Description

Wireframe Pilot is a Figma plugin that lets you create beautiful, professional low-fi landing page wireframes for a wide range of industries—instantly. Choose from free, hardcoded industry templates or use AI to generate custom content and color schemes tailored to your business. Perfect for designers, agencies, and business owners who want to jumpstart their web projects with best-practice layouts and content.


Key Features

* One-click wireframe generation for 12+ industries (landscaping, tech, law, etc.)

* AI-powered content and color palette generation (with the option to use your own OpenAI API key)

* Customizable sections, layouts, and color schemes

* No coding required—everything happens inside Figma


Instructions

1. Open the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Select your industry and customize sections, layouts, and colors as desired.

3. (Optional) Enter your OpenAI API key to unlock AI-powered content and color generation.

4. Click “Generate Wireframe” to add a complete landing page wireframe to your canvas.

5. Edit and iterate as needed!
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate modern, wireframes for landing pages within in Figma.

138266.name: Wireframe Pilot
138266.description:

5. Edit and iterate as needed!

networkAccess.reasoning: This plugin needs access to OpenAI's API for generating color schemes and content, Google Fonts for loading the Inter font family, and the custom backend for AI proxy.

138266.release_notes:
What's changed in this new version?

Interface Updates:
- Implemented a streamlined toggle switch for Basic/Pro mode selection
- Enhanced UI layout with improved visual hierarchy
- Optimized dialog interface for better Figma integration
- Refined input controls and button states

Technical Improvements:
- Enhanced accessibility compliance
- Optimized plugin initialization
- Refined error handling and user feedback

System Enhancements:
- Enhanced API key management system
- Improved visual feedback for system status
- Updated user interface components for better consistency
138266.tagline: Instantly generate modern, wireframes for landing pages within in Figma.

plugins.name: Padding Scaler
plugins.description:
Padding Scaler helps designers rapidly create compact, default, and spacious layout variants by scaling the vertical paddings of auto-layout frames.


Instead of editing each value manually, simply select your frames, choose a scale (0.5× to 4×), and instantly apply consistent spacing changes.


Ideal for testing different density modes or aligning with design system spacing tokens.


✨ Features:


Works with one or many auto-layout frames


Choose vertical, horizontal, or both directions


Fast, intuitive UI with live scaling preview


Save time, stay consistent, and iterate layout decisions faster.
plugins.tagline: Instantly scale vertical and/or horizontal paddings in auto-layout frames to test density modes.

134488.name: Padding Scaler
134488.description:
Padding Scaler helps designers rapidly create compact, default, and spacious layout variants by scaling the vertical paddings of auto-layout frames.


Instead of editing each value manually, simply select your frames, choose a scale (0.5× to 4×), and instantly apply consistent spacing changes.


Ideal for testing different density modes or aligning with design system spacing tokens.


✨ Features:


Works with one or many auto-layout frames


Choose vertical, horizontal, or both directions


Fast, intuitive UI with live scaling preview


Save time, stay consistent, and iterate layout decisions faster.
134488.tagline: Instantly scale vertical and/or horizontal paddings in auto-layout frames to test density modes.

plugins.name: World Clock
plugins.description:
Stay in sync with your global team — right inside Figma.

World Clock Plugin lets you add real-time clocks for any city around the world. Just type a city name, select it, and instantly view its current time in a beautifully minimal interface.


Perfect for remote teams, cross-border collabs, and late-night design sprints.
plugins.tagline: Never ask ‘What time is it there?’ again.

134090.name: World Clock
134090.description:
Stay in sync with your global team — right inside Figma.

World Clock Plugin lets you add real-time clocks for any city around the world. Just type a city name, select it, and instantly view its current time in a beautifully minimal interface.


Perfect for remote teams, cross-border collabs, and late-night design sprints.
134090.tagline: Never ask ‘What time is it there?’ again.

plugins.name: Tokenize Your Design
plugins.description:
Tokenize Your Design helps you bring consistency and scalability to your Figma files by automatically replacing static colors with matching token values from your design system.


✅ Key features:

•Scan your entire design file to detect non-token colors

•Match them with the color tokens from your local design system

•Maintain consistent styling across large-scale designs


Perfect for design system maintainers, developers and teams aiming to scale design efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Bring consistency to your design by mapping colors to design system tokens.

133450.name: Tokenize Your Design
133450.description:
Tokenize Your Design helps you bring consistency and scalability to your Figma files by automatically replacing static colors with matching token values from your design system.


✅ Key features:

•Scan your entire design file to detect non-token colors

•Match them with the color tokens from your local design system

•Maintain consistent styling across large-scale designs


Perfect for design system maintainers, developers and teams aiming to scale design efficiently.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin may need to access resources from any domain for maximum flexibility during development and for future integrations.

133450.release_notes: In this version, the stroke colors will also be updated along with the fill color tokens.
133450.tagline: Bring consistency to your design by mapping colors to design system tokens.

plugins.name: Reverse Variable Order
plugins.description:
Easily reverse the order of your variable values with


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Reverse


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Flip the order of values in your variable groups

132291.name: Reverse Variable Order
132291.description:
Easily reverse the order of your variable values with


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Reverse


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.
132291.tagline: Flip the order of values in your variable groups

plugins.name: Find Elements
plugins.description:
Using this tool, we can find any Text Nodes having phrase 'Lorem' i.e. dummy text across the entire page. Then we can find any Text Nodes which do not match the font parameters i.e. Font Family, Style and Size. Finally, we can also find all nodes not matching the color given in hex values.

This is tool is helpful to find mis-matched items based on the given parameters.
plugins.tagline: Find text having 'Lorem', find text with non-matching font and find items with non-matching colors

135964.name: Find Elements
135964.description:

This is tool is helpful to find mis-matched items based on the given parameters.
135964.tagline: Find text having 'Lorem', find text with non-matching font and find items with non-matching colors

Também permite exportar diretamente a seleção como imagem WebP (otimizada) ou SVG vetorial.


Funciona 100% dentro do Figma, sem dependências externas.
plugins.tagline: Converta textos em HTML com tags visuais e exporte como WebP ou SVG

plugins.name: Fig-Refactor
plugins.description:
Call for Sponsorship: Support the Development


Fig-Refactor – Replace Spacing with Figma Variables in One Click


Fig-Refactor is a Figma plugin designed to bring structure and scalability to your design files by replacing hardcoded gaps and paddings with Figma variables — in bulk.


Fig-Refactor intelligently scans your selection or entire file, matches raw spacing values to the closest variable from your local or team library, and replaces them with a single click. It even skips values already using variables, keeping your workflow non-destructive and efficient.


✨ Features:

  1. 🔍 Smart matching – Suggests the closest variable for each spacing value
  2. 🧠 Supports team libraries – Load and use variables from shared libraries
  3. 📁 Flexible scanning – Target specific selections or scan the entire file
  4. 🚫 Non-destructive – Ignores values already assigned to a variable


Currently in active development, Fig-Refactor is already making design systems cleaner and easier to manage — and with your support, it can go even further. Your sponsorship helps fund ongoing development, bug fixes, and new features like auto-thresholds, preview modes, and batch review.


📹 DEMO

❤️ Support this project


Your support helps keep this plugin alive and evolving.

Thank you for making design better for everyone!
plugins.tagline: Refactor Your  Figma Spacing  in Seconds

Fig-Refactor intelligently scans your selection or entire file, matches raw spacing values to the closest variable from your local or team library, and replaces them with a single click. It even skips values already using variables, keeping your workflow non-destructive and efficient.

Currently in active development, Fig-Refactor is already making design systems cleaner and easier to manage — and with your support, it can go even further. Your sponsorship helps fund ongoing development, bug fixes, and new features like auto-thresholds, preview modes, and batch review.

plugins.name: Component Mapping Kit
plugins.description:
A toolkit for efficiently visualizing and managing components in Figma designs.


Features:

  1. Automatic component detection within frames
  2. Component filtering by name
  3. Customizable overlay colors and sizes
  4. Component name labels
  5. Detailed settings in options panel
plugins.tagline: Efficiently visualizing components in Figma design

plugins.name: StyleSync
plugins.description: StyleSync extracts text and color styles as well as color variables in your Figma file, lets you select what you need, then generates a JSON that you paste into the companion Framer Plugin that instantly recreates the styles in Framer.
plugins.tagline: Export text and color styles and color variables from Figma and import into Framer.

129256.tagline: Export text and color styles and color variables from Figma and import into Framer.

plugins.name: RatioRects
plugins.description:
Proportional Rectangle Generator is a Figma plugin designed specifically for designers, aimed at simplifying rectangle creation and sizing processes. Through intelligent proportion calculation and an intuitive interface, it helps designers quickly generate precise and consistent rectangular shapes.


Feature Highlights ✨

Precision Design Tools

🎯 Accurate Proportion Calculation

📐 Diverse Proportion Selections

🔄 Bidirectional Size Inference

📱 Supports Horizontal and Vertical Orientation Switching

Smart Design Assistance

🖌 Real-time Visual Preview

🎨 Intelligent Background Color Adaptation

✂️ Adjustable Selected Shapes

🖥 Rich Preset Proportion Library
plugins.tagline: Generate proportional rectangles with a single click, simplifying size calculations.

plugins.name: Fill Swap
plugins.description:
Fill Swap

Effortlessly swap in and out fills and remix your designs with randomized solid colors, gradients, images, and more — without moving or disrupting your layout. It’s the ultimate productivity hack for mood boards, prototypes, and rapid design exploration. Fast, fun, and non-destructive.


Try it for free, and see what clicks.
plugins.tagline: Randomly swap fills within a selection

133576.name: Fill Swap
133576.description:
Fill Swap

Effortlessly swap in and out fills and remix your designs with randomized solid colors, gradients, images, and more — without moving or disrupting your layout. It’s the ultimate productivity hack for mood boards, prototypes, and rapid design exploration. Fast, fun, and non-destructive.


Try it for free, and see what clicks.
133576.release_notes:
What’s New

- Improved performance for a smoother experience.
- Added Auto-Run on Launch option for keyboard shortcut configuration.
- Text layers within selections are now automatically ignored.
- Free evaluation period now available
133576.tagline: Randomly swap fills within a selection

plugins.name: Round Off
plugins.description:
This plugin helps avoid the Figma export bug where any decimal values in a frame's position values are are rounded up on export, resulting in a subpixel white line on the sides of your exported PNGs.


Apply to all top-level frames or to just to frames selected and remove all decimal values from the x and y positions before export.


Never see that white line again!
plugins.tagline: Avoid PNG export bugs by rounding off all decimals from your top level frames' position values.

130230.name: Round Off
130230.description:
This plugin helps avoid the Figma export bug where any decimal values in a frame's position values are are rounded up on export, resulting in a subpixel white line on the sides of your exported PNGs.


Apply to all top-level frames or to just to frames selected and remove all decimal values from the x and y positions before export.


Never see that white line again!
130230.tagline: Avoid PNG export bugs by rounding off all decimals from your top level frames' position values.

plugins.name: Holy Shade
plugins.description:
Holy Shade - A Color Matching Challenge! 🎨


Test your color perception skills with Holy Shade, a fun and engaging game designed for designers, artists, and color enthusiasts! 🖌️


🔍 How to Play:


A target color is displayed at the top.


Choose the matching shade from the options below.


The closer your choice, the higher your score!


💡 Why Play?


Improve your color differentiation skills.


Sharpen your ability to recognize subtle shade variations.


Challenge yourself and compete for the highest score!


Are you ready to master the art of color perception? 🌈✨
plugins.tagline: A Color Matching Challenge!

plugins.name: Export to Denada
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
plugins.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

121997.name: Export to Denada
121997.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
121997.release_notes: Allow exporting any layer, not just Frame layers.
121997.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

plugins.name: Layout Aware Renaming
plugins.description:
Features

- Auto-Detect Grids: Automatically detects rows and columns in your selection.

- Custom Naming: Add prefixes and choose between numeric or alphabetic suffixes.

- Manual Override: Specify exact rows/columns when auto-detection fails.

- Mixed Sizes: Works with elements of different sizes in the same grid.

- Figma & FigJam: Compatible with both Figma and FigJam (limited support).
plugins.tagline: Automatically rename elements based on their grid layout.

116823.name: Layout Aware Renaming
116823.description:
Features

- Auto-Detect Grids: Automatically detects rows and columns in your selection.

- Custom Naming: Add prefixes and choose between numeric or alphabetic suffixes.

- Manual Override: Specify exact rows/columns when auto-detection fails.

- Mixed Sizes: Works with elements of different sizes in the same grid.

- Figma & FigJam: Compatible with both Figma and FigJam (limited support).
116823.tagline: Automatically rename elements based on their grid layout.

115447.tagline: Generate Figma styles from Tailwind CSS

plugins.name: Maruco
plugins.description:
What is this?

Maruco is a plugin that provides rules and validation for component naming, helping you identify components that violate naming conventions and elements.


1. Selecting naming convention.

There are several conventions, let's select the best one for your project.


2. Entering naming elements.

Next, you can enter "words" that makes up the component's name.

Enter a comma between words to set multiple words.

Maruco guesses that the component's name is made up of three elements: a prefix, a middle word and a suffix.


3. Running validation.

That's all. Let's run the validation.
plugins.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

117124.name: Maruco
117124.description:
What is this?

3. Running validation.

That's all. Let's run the validation.
117124.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

plugins.name: 数据生成图表可视化工具（专业版） Data Vision Chart Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin enables users to create beautiful and interactive charts directly within Figma. Whether you need a bar, line, donut, or pie chart, the plugin offers real-time updates and customizable styles for seamless data visualization.


Function Description

  1. Create different chart types: Line, Bar, Donut, and Pie charts.
  2. Customize chart styles with predefined themes or use custom colors.
  3. Easily add, edit, and remove data rows with an intuitive interface.
  4. Export generated charts directly as Figma frames for further design use.
  5. Support for multiple languages, including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select the chart type you want to create.
  2. Input the required data and choose a predefined color scheme or customize it.
  3. Set the chart dimensions (width and height) as per your design needs.
  4. Click "Generate Chart" to create the chart frame in Figma.
  5. Customize the chart further by adjusting colors and data points as needed.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports dynamic data updates and real-time chart previews.
  2. Ensure that all necessary data rows are filled to avoid incomplete chart generation.
  3. You can switch between chart types to explore different data visualizations.


介绍

此插件让用户可以直接在 Figma 中创建漂亮且交互式的图表。无论是柱状图、折线图、环形图还是饼图，插件都提供实时更新和自定义样式，助力轻松进行数据可视化。


功能说明

  1. 支持生成不同类型的图表：折线图、柱状图、环形图和饼图。
  2. 提供多种预设主题配色，或使用自定义颜色。
  3. 直观界面，轻松添加、编辑和删除数据行。
  4. 将生成的图表直接导出为 Figma 的框架，用于后续设计。
  5. 支持多种语言，包括英语、简体中文、繁体中文、印地语、日语和韩语。


使用方法

  1. 选择您需要创建的图表类型。
  2. 输入所需数据，选择预设配色或自定义颜色。
  3. 根据设计需要设置图表尺寸（宽度和高度）。
  4. 点击“生成图表”按钮，即可在 Figma 中创建图表框架。
  5. 您可以根据需要进一步调整图表的颜色和数据点。


注意事项

  1. 插件支持动态数据更新和实时图表预览。
  2. 确保所有必要的数据行已填写完整，以避免生成不完整的图表。
  3. 您可以在不同的图表类型之间切换，探索不同的数据可视化效果。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Generate stunning charts for data visualization with ease

plugins.name: 打印工具 Figma Print Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

Figma Print Pro is a specialized plugin that helps you create print-ready documents directly in Figma. Easily set up standard or custom page sizes, add bleed areas and crop marks, export high-quality PDFs in multiple color formats, and ensure professional results with built-in DPI checks.


Function Description

  1. Custom & Preset Dimensions: Choose from popular print sizes (A4, A3, B5) or enter exact dimensions.
  2. Bleed & Crop Marks: Add bleed lines and crop marks to prepare for professional trimming.
  3. Multi-page Documents: Generate multi-page print layouts all within a single Figma file.
  4. Color Management: Export PDFs in RGB, CMYK, or grayscale for precise color control.
  5. Adjustable Image Quality: Downsample images and set compression levels to optimize file size.
  6. DPI Checks: Analyze frames to confirm whether resolution meets professional print standards.


Usage

  1. Set Up a Document: In the plugin panel, pick a preset size (A4, A3, B5) or enter your custom width and height.
  2. Adjust Settings: Define bleed margins, enable crop marks, and specify the page count.
  3. Preview: The plugin generates a quick visual preview of each page.
  4. Export to PDF: Choose a color format (RGB, CMYK, or grayscale), select image quality settings, then export.
  5. Check DPI: Run the DPI check tool to ensure images and frames meet print-quality standards.


Tips

  1. Recommended DPI: For most print jobs, 300 DPI is standard. Ensure your images and frames meet or exceed this resolution.
  2. Color Consistency: When using CMYK, note that colors may differ slightly from on-screen previews.
  3. Bleed Setup: If your printer requires a bleed, confirm the exact measurement specifications with your print provider.
  4. Downsampling: Keep an eye on image clarity if you significantly reduce the DPI to minimize file size.


介绍

Figma Print Pro 是一款专为在 Figma 中直接创建印刷文档的插件。它支持自定义或常见的标准纸张尺寸，允许添加出血线和裁切线，支持导出多种颜色格式的高质量 PDF，并可进行 DPI 检查，帮助您轻松获得专业的印刷效果。


功能说明

  1. 自定义与预设尺寸：可使用常见的印刷尺寸（A4、A3、B5）或自行输入宽高。
  2. 出血线与裁切线：可配置出血线并添加裁切线，满足专业印刷需求。
  3. 多页文档：在单个 Figma 文件中快速生成多页的打印版面。
  4. 颜色管理：支持 RGB、CMYK 以及灰度输出，便于精确控制印刷颜色。
  5. 可调节图像质量：支持图像降采样并可设置压缩比，实现更小文件体积。
  6. DPI 检查：可检查 Frame 分辨率，判断是否符合专业印刷要求。


使用方法

  1. 文档设置：在插件面板中，选择 A4、A3、B5 等预设尺寸，或手动输入自定义宽高。
  2. 参数调整：设定出血值、是否添加裁切线，以及需要的页面数量。
  3. 预览页面：插件会生成每页的预览，方便快速查看效果。
  4. 导出 PDF：选择颜色模式（RGB、CMYK 或灰度），根据需求调整图像质量后即可导出。
  5. 检查 DPI：使用 DPI 检查功能，确保图像或 Frame 的分辨率达到了可印刷的标准。


注意事项

  1. 建议 DPI：一般印刷要求 300 DPI，确保图像及画框分辨率符合或高于该标准。
  2. 颜色差异：使用 CMYK 模式时，实际印刷颜色可能与屏幕上显示的略有偏差。
  3. 出血线设置：如印刷厂有特殊要求，请提前确认所需的出血值。
  4. 图像降采样：若大幅降低分辨率以减小文件体积，需注意图像清晰度的影响。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Streamline print creation & DPI checks in Figma

功能说明

  1. 自定义与预设尺寸：可使用常见的印刷尺寸（A4、A3、B5）或自行输入宽高。
  2. 出血线与裁切线：可配置出血线并添加裁切线，满足专业印刷需求。
  3. 多页文档：在单个 Figma 文件中快速生成多页的打印版面。
  4. 颜色管理：支持 RGB、CMYK 以及灰度输出，便于精确控制印刷颜色。
  5. 可调节图像质量：支持图像降采样并可设置压缩比，实现更小文件体积。
  6. DPI 检查：可检查 Frame 分辨率，判断是否符合专业印刷要求。


使用方法

  1. 文档设置：在插件面板中，选择 A4、A3、B5 等预设尺寸，或手动输入自定义宽高。
  2. 参数调整：设定出血值、是否添加裁切线，以及需要的页面数量。
  3. 预览页面：插件会生成每页的预览，方便快速查看效果。
  4. 导出 PDF：选择颜色模式（RGB、CMYK 或灰度），根据需求调整图像质量后即可导出。
  5. 检查 DPI：使用 DPI 检查功能，确保图像或 Frame 的分辨率达到了可印刷的标准。


注意事项

  1. 建议 DPI：一般印刷要求 300 DPI，确保图像及画框分辨率符合或高于该标准。
  2. 颜色差异：使用 CMYK 模式时，实际印刷颜色可能与屏幕上显示的略有偏差。
  3. 出血线设置：如印刷厂有特殊要求，请提前确认所需的出血值。
  4. 图像降采样：若大幅降低分辨率以减小文件体积，需注意图像清晰度的影响。

manifest.name: 打印工具 Figma Print Pro

137683.tagline: Streamline print creation & DPI checks in Figma

plugins.name: Osouji
plugins.description:
整理整頓したいアイテム群選択後にこのプラグインを起動すると、同じ名前のフレームや、テキスト、シェイプ、画像などを自動的にグループ化して一覧化してくれます。作業スペースが整理され、過去のアイデアを見つけやすくなりますよ！


----


When you start this plug-in after selecting a group of items you want to organize, frames with the same name, text, shapes, images, etc. will be automatically grouped and listed. Your workspace will be organized and it will be easier to find past ideas!
plugins.tagline: 選択したアイテムを自動でグループ化し、整理整頓された一覧を作成します。

plugins.name: Description Generator - AI Powered 🚀
plugins.description:
Boost your design documentation effortlessly!


This plugin scans your Figma file and auto-generates descriptions for Components, Component Sets and Variants either using smart rule-based logic or your preferred AI provider (ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, Mistral, Cohere, OpenRouter, Grok).


Choose your method, enter your API key (for AI) and get consistent, scalable, and meaningful descriptions right where they belong.


✅ Rule-based generation

🤖 AI-powered description (via API Key)

🧠 Supports Components, Sets & Variants

🌍 Supports 11 languages (🇬🇧 English, 🇹🇷 Türkçe, 🇩🇪 Deutsch, 🇫🇷 Français, 🇪🇸 Español, 🇮🇹 Italiano, 🇵🇹 Português, 🇷🇺 Русский, 🇯🇵 日本語, 🇰🇷 한국어, 🇨🇳 中文)

🧩 Designed for structured design systems
plugins.tagline: Auto generate component descriptions with rules or AI ✨

plugins.name: Gradientify
plugins.description:
Bring vibrant, layered gradients into your Figma designs. With this plugin, you can:


  1. Generate random gradients with an optional noise effect
  2. Paste CSS code from gradientify.app to apply gradients to layers
  3. Use gradients as fill properties for easy customization


Free trial

Try it out up to 5 times in each mode (random generation and CSS import), or unlock unlimited use with a license key.


Thank you for your support

This plugin was built to complement gradientify.app, a free tool for designing and animating gradients for the web. Buying a license helps keep the project going ❤️


Contact me:

If you have questions or comments, please send me a message to rengifo.eder@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Generate and paste CSS gradients to layers as fill properties

plugins.name: Fastr Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin can convert a Figma file into a Fastr compatible format. This will generate a .zip file that you can import into Fastr Frontend platform. One quick import is all it takes to transform your Figma files into fully interactive experiences—brand components, fonts, and layouts intact. Get ready to edit, animate, and publish designs faster than ever before.


How to use the plug-in

If you have any issues when using the plugin, we recommend visiting our community article, which has a full guide and FAQs. For more information about the Fastr Frontend platform, please visit our website.


Reporting Issues

For any questions, please email support@getfastr.com and our team can assist further


License


This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

Copyright (c) KALEIDOS INC

The Fastr Exporter was built using the Penpot Exporter.

Penpot and the Penpot exporter plugin are Kaleidos’ open source projects.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Bring Your Figma Designs into Fastr Frontend

plugins.name: Text Flow
plugins.description:
「Text Flow」は、指定したレイヤー名のテキストに用意したテキストを流し込むプラグインです。これで、テキストのコピペ地獄とはサヨナラ！Figmaでのデザイン作業をスピードアップすることができます。


  1. レイヤー名の設定：テキストを入力したいレイヤーに、共通の名前をつけます。
  2. テキストの準備：流し込みたいテキストを、改行で区切って準備します。
  3. 対象オブジェクトの選択：プラグインを起動し、テキストを適用したいグループやコンポーネントを選びます。
  4. 入力と適用：レイヤー名とテキストを入力して、「適用」ボタンをクリックします。
plugins.tagline: テキスト流し込みを効率化

plugins.name: Font Classifier
plugins.description:
Font Classifier helps designers sort fonts into custom categories like Serif, Display, Branding, and more.

Quickly preview and apply fonts to selected text layers in Figma without digging through the full font list.

No more scrolling through 1000+ alphabetically listed fonts — just categorize your favorites and access them instantly.

Ideal for web, UI, and graphic designers who want faster access to curated typefaces.

Save time, stay consistent, and build your own font system directly in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Organize, preview, and apply fonts by category — faster typography for designers.

plugins.name: Empty Layer Detector
plugins.description:
Empty Layer Detector helps you keep your Figma files clean and organized by detecting:


🔍 Invisible layers

📏 Zero-size objects

📦 Empty containers

🟥 Solid-color-only layers with no content


You can customize what to check with filters, view results grouped by issue type, and click to focus directly on problematic layers.


✅ Supports multi-page scanning

✅ Grouped accordion results

✅ No external dependencies
plugins.tagline: Quickly find invisible, zero-size, or empty elements in your Figma files.
